summary: An ordinance authorizing, empowering, and directing the Board of Public Works to compel the owner of the property immediately abutting upon any sidewalk in the City of Seattle which may or shall become in such a condition as to render the same unfit, or unsafe for public travel, to renew or repair the same, and authorizing the Board of Public Works, in case the owner fails to make such renewal or repairs, to renew or repair the same at the expense of said owner, and to charge said expense as a lien upon said property, and accepting the powers conferred upon the City of Seattle, by Chapter 37 of the Laws of 1905, of the Legislature of the State of Washington, and declaring an emergency.
